intro: Jatropha decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive jatropha, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that are often mistaken for edible plants, leading to its deceptive common name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Jatropha decipiens is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
